data.name: plDefault.Help
data.value: New records will use this default value

data.name: plEditStyle.Help
data.value: Style which is applied on text box or list control in form, e.g. "width:300px"

data.name: plHelpText.Help
data.value: This is the Help Text displayed to the user to explain this field.

data.name: plName.Help
data.value:
Enter field name,strongly recommend enter latin characters. Note, some words are already used in video tables, so you can't enter them as field name.
The restricted words (case insensitive) include: Id,TypeId,PortalId,UserId,UserName,CreatedDate,Quote,Title,
Author,Source,Thumbnail,Image,LinkUrl,Summary,Description,Field1,
Field2,Field3,Field4,Field5,DisplayOrder,PublishDate,
ExpireDate,LastModifiedDate,SubmitDate,AuthedDate,VideoFile,VideoPath,
Duration,HttpType,Streamer,VideoType,MasterVideoId,SerialOrder,
Audio,Active,Authed,Featured,Views,
AllowComment,CommentRoles,AutoAuthComment,CommentCount,AllowRating,
Categories,Tags,RatingRoles,RatingTotal,RatingCount,RatingAverage,AllowRecommend,
RecommendRoles,RecommendCount,RecommendUp,RecommendDown,DownloadRoles,Private, Protect,ProtectPassword.

data.name: plRequired.Help
data.value: If checked, user must enter value for this field

data.name: plTitle.Help
data.value: Enter filed title which will be display when editing.Leave it as blank will use field name as edit title.

data.name: plType.Help
data.value: Choose data type. Note, it can't be modified after added, so choose it carefully when you add it first time.

data.name: plValidationMessage.Help
data.value: This message will be displayed if the user entered value violates the Validation Rule.

data.name: plValidationRule.Help
data.value: This Regular Expression is used to validate the value entered by the user. Failure to match this Regular Expression will prevent the record from being updated.

data.name: ExistingWords.Text
data.value: Field name already existing, please check it.

data.name: RestrictedWords.Text
data.value:
You enter a restricted words as field name, please change it. Some words are already used in video tables, so you can't enter them as field name.
The restricted words (case insensitive) include :Id,TypeId,PortalId,UserId,UserName,CreatedDate,Quote,Title,
Author,Source,Thumbnail,Image,LinkUrl,Summary,Description,Field1,

data.name: lblRetrictWords.Text
data.value:
Note, some words are already used in video tables, so you can't enter them as field name.
  The restricted words (case insensitive) include: Id,TypeId,PortalId,UserId,UserName,CreatedDate,Quote,Title,
Author,Source,Thumbnail,Image,LinkUrl,Summary,Description,Field1,
Field2,Field3,Field4,Field5,DisplayOrder,PublishDate,
ExpireDate,LastModifiedDate,SubmitDate,AuthedDate,VideoFile,VideoPath,
Duration,HttpType,Streamer,VideoType,MasterVideoId,SerialOrder,
Audio,Active,Authed,Featured,Views,
AllowComment,CommentRoles,AutoAuthComment,CommentCount,AllowRating,
Categories,Tags,RatingRoles,RatingTotal,RatingCount,RatingAverage,AllowRecommend,
RecommendRoles,RecommendCount,RecommendUp,RecommendDown,DownloadRoles,Private, Protect,ProtectPassword.

data.name: Tip_AddAttribute.Text
data.value:
Attributes are used to create inter-dependant media variations. After create an attribute, author can then create specific attribute values for an individual media.

  For example, if you want to create a "Color" attribute, you can do it as follows:
  1. Input "Color" as "Field Name",
  2. Input "Cloth Color" as "Field Title" (optional) .
  3. Input "Enter cloth color, like red, green, white" as "Help Text" (optional).
  4. Click "Update"
  Then author will see a "Cloth Color" field while edit media. He can specify its value for each media (e.g. "White").

  You can also provide a list of values to let author choose. For example, if you input "red;green;white" (separate by semicolon, name|value pairs like "One|1;Two|2;Three|3" also acceptable) as "List of Values", then author can only choose value from "red", "green" and "white". You can even specify a default value. For example, if you input "red" as "Default Value", then "color" value will be set as "red" if author doesn't change it.

  "Drop down list" and "Radio button list" only allow select one from "List of values". "Check box list" allows you select multiple items from "List of values". You can also input multiple value like "red;green" in "default value" for "check box list", so both "red" and "green" check box will be choosen by default.

data.name: li_CheckBoxsHorizontal.Text
data.value: Display as check box list (horizontal align)

data.name: li_CheckBoxsVertical.Text
data.value: Display as check box list (vertical align)

data.name: li_RadioButtonsHorizontal.Text
data.value: Display as radio button list (horizontal align)

data.name: li_RadioButtonsVertical.Text
data.value: Display as radio button list (vertical align)
